name: The Esplanade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for an overnight stay with my Husband, booked a sea view room, small but adequate for one night, Bed appeared to be a small double and had seen better days. Room was very clean and provided tea and coffee and a small bottle of water.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Owners friendly.
reviews.title: Convenient spot with terrific views from the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good we both had a full english/welsh!! But there was also fruit,cerals etc.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We both had fried bread I am not a lover of that and would've preferred to have had another choice!
reviews.title: Brilliant proprietors, perfect location, clean room, ... but hard bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a good small hotel that was good value for money and would stay again.
reviews.title: GOOD FOR THE DOGS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a two night break recently and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves .Our room(14)had a huge bay window overlooking the sea and Caldy Island with two comfortable chairs and a table in the window,large tv,4 poster bed(we had to take a run-up to get into this as we are both short!!) and large bathroom .The bed was very comfortable and the room warm and cosy despite the howling wind outside every night!
reviews.title: Fantastic view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfasts were really good......lots of fruit,yoghurt,cereals,good coffee, then cooked to order whatever you wanted......my boiled egg was perfect!!Lovely views over the sea from the dining room too.
reviews.title: Tenby Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No real downers apart from the lack of parking right by the hotel....you can grab a free spot opposite if you are lucky,but beware of parking in the residents only places.....the traffic wardens are VERY keen and come round regularly giving out tickets(we watched them from our window!)There is a large car park just up the road where you can leave your car overnight.....a matter of yards away.
reviews.title: Super place - you must try it !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hosts were very friendly and helpful and the whole place is clean and tidy .The decor is a bit tired and dated,but our room was lovely and we've certainly had worse rooms in 5 star hotels for double the money.I wouldn't say it was suitable for anyone with walking difficulties though as the steps to get in are rather steep and there is no lift.
reviews.title: Number One is number one in our vote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Esplanade is also ideally placed for walks along the fabulous beach or into the town which is on the doorstep,and we would use it again if we visit Tenby another time.
reviews.title: we picked a great hotel, will go again for sure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This guesthouse or BB whatever you want to call it has decent rooms with great views over the ocean. It does not really have a lot of taste though, as the four poster beds and the furniture could have been my old granny's.
reviews.title: A nice spot but very old fashioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was also old, but all was clean nonetheless. I do remeber we did pay quite a price for the room. Tenby is a fantastic place to stay and the hotel is very central everything walking distance, so a decent choice.
reviews.title: Superb location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wonderful view from rooms at the front. Ideal location - not in the centre of everything but within short walking distance. Alongside the town wall. Property was clean and well run. Owners hands-on and very pleasant. Very good cooked to order breakfasts.
reviews.title: Lovely welcome, great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister and mother and I had booked into another hotel, but on arrival decided not to stay there. We then had the task of finding another one at such short notice. The Esplanade gave us such a warm welcome and it was no trouble at all the shows the available rooms. My sister and I had a family room, with a settee, balcony and sea view, it was really comfortable, loads of space and lovely cotton sheets. Mum had a single room, again this was great but without the view. The location of this hotel is so wonderful, just across the road literally are ample benches where you can spend hours (mum did) literally gazing out to see or reading, with the hotel on hand for coffees and use of the toilets or back to the room. So near to town, but away from any hustle and bustle and noise at night. Would thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed one night, had a room with a nice view, however the most important part was bad, the matrass, it was small and we rolled off the bed on boith sides, when you turn your hear the steel springs jump.
reviews.title: Not as good as its promoted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Tenby hotel for 3 nights in a premier double room (110 Pounds !) which was actually next door of the hotel. The hotel room is a suite with an ample and exclusively furbished living room (leather settee and chairs, flat screen TV, coffee table etc.), a cosy bed room with a four-poster bed and a luxurious bath room with a but tub with jets.
reviews.title: Top location, luxury room with sea view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is in the ground floor of the house next door of the hotel and it has a direct sea view, the bed room is facing to the back yard. Since there are private flats in the same house, there was occasionally some noise from the neighbours but it was usually quiet after 10 pm. There was no WiFi in the hotel room (as it is located outside of the hotel), however free WiFi is available in the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The manager of the hotel was very friendly, the service is excellent and the waitresses always served breakfast with a smile on their face and were looking after the guests with great care. Breakfast was rich and excellent quality.
reviews.title: Good hotel - brilliant breakfst.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel does not have car park for guests, but guests can park the car in one of the side roads around the hotel for free.
reviews.title: The best in Tenby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a spectacular view from our room onto the sea. The town centre is 3 minutes walk away from the hotel.
reviews.title: 70th birthday break

description: Situated alongside the town walls and overlooking South Beach, this 4 Star Guest Accommodation has magnificent views across Carmarthen Bay towards the islands of Caldy and St Catherines, and on a clear day, the north Devon coast.Access to the beautifully sandy South Beach is directly in front on TheEsplanade.A two minute walk will take you into the charming walled town of Tenby with it's wide selection of shops and restaurants.Run by proprietors Peter and Julie Andrasko who took over in April 2004.
